article.headline: Valparaiso blows by Maine 93-70
article.story: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. -- Alec Peters hit four 3-pointers and finished with a career-high 31 points to help Valparaiso beat Maine 93-70 on Sunday. Peters was 9 of 13 from the field, hit 9 of 10 from the free-throw line and grabbed six rebounds for Valparaiso (4-1). The Crusaders made 53.3 percent of their shots, including 12 of 21 from behind the arc. Shaun Lawton led Maine (0-4) with 16 and Kevin Little had 15. Aaron Calixte and Marko Pirovic added 10 apiece for the Black Bears. Peters scored eight points during Valparaiso's 17-2 run to start the game. He had 15 points through the first 8 minutes and finished with 22 points in the first half. Valparaiso went on to lead 52-28 at halftime after shooting 61.3 percent from the field. Tevonn Walker hit two free throws with 12:13 left to give Valparaiso a 33-point lead, its largest of the game.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
